name: Hotel Subur

reviews.text: We booked this hotel earlier this year direct with the hotel. I must admit that right from the start the impression I got was of bad organisation. They did not reply to e-mails and I had to ring the hotel several times to get the confirmation through, even after they had taken my credit card number. On arrival, the reception staff seemed pleasant enough and checked us in quickly. When we got to the room we were horrified! It was a small, grim room (214) with a tiny window that you could not even see through without standing on tiptoe. It was frosted glass and looked out onto some inner yard. We went straight back down and thank goodness we had the e-mail confirming we had booked a sea view room. We could have lived without a sea view, but a balcony was essential! They quickly moved us to room 311 which looked onto the side street and had a partial sea view.
reviews.title: Beware of some rooms!

reviews.text: It was obvious that the hotel was not full so why had we been placed at first in what looked like a cell?????? Was it because we were English and they thought we would accept such a pit at 132 euros a night? We noticed that two Canadians were booking in for 3 nights like us and they got a room with balcony first time round! On the plus side, the staff continued to be helpful and friendly and the location is great, but overall the hotel is more two star than three. The bathroom was particularly small and shabby. Just beware - if your'e not careful, you could find yourself in the grimmest room you'll ever be expected to stay in - if wanting a balcony room make sure you get it in writing - otherwise your stay here could be hell!
reviews.title: Stay away from rooms without sea-view

likes.disliked: — room is of small size and would definitely need renovation, especially bathroom

reviews.title: Don't take Room 106 !
reviews.text: Location is perfect but rooms are old-fashion and either tiny or dark (I only talk about rooms without sea-view, because I only saw these ones).

I paid nearly 600 euros for a week in the middle of August and when I arrived I was so happy about the location, right on the beach. But don't get your hopes up, there are only about 9 rooms that face the sea and most face a side street. The reception staff booked us into ROOM 106....It is the WORST room I have been offered in my travels throughout the world.....the beds are twin and pushed together in what is no more than a large cupboard...there are two frosted over windows with a sole view of the air conditioning vent. I refused to accept it and wouldn't budge till they changed us to another...they were not happy. Did they really expect us to stay in there for a week? It seems pot luck to get a sea view room and one wasn't offered despite the request 3 months previous and a phone call two days before. The staff aren't particularly friendly and this is no more than a two star hotel at the very most. The best thing is the situation, near the bars and clubs but I have stayed in Sitges a few times and to tell you the truth cheaper hotels like the El Cid have been much better value with great staff
reviews.title: Wonderful veiw

reviews.text: I wish I could give this hotel 5 stars. Had it not been for an unfortuanate incident with a pigeon I would have done!
reviews.title: Poor reception staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the Subur is excellent. It has to be in the best spot in Sitges.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: It is also spotlessly clean and the reception staff are very friendly and helpful. A big plus for me were also the coin operated internet terminals. 50 cents seemed to last for ages.
reviews.title: Great price- Great location- Average hotel

reviews.text: However what you need to remember about the Subur is that there are essentially three grades of room. The ones without balconies overlooking the back of the adjacent buildings and rooftops are very small and a bit gloomy. They are however the cheapest.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Much better are the balcony rooms on the side of the building. They are larger and it is nice to sit outside. The best though are the ones on the front with balconies overlooking the sea. These are excellent and real suntraps.
reviews.title: For the Price, Can't Beat It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What you need to bear in mind is that if you go for the cheapest internet rate you will get the gloomy rooms. However if they have the availability they will upgrade you when you get there for a little extra. It really is worth it.
reviews.title: Don't even think about it!

reviews.text: This had an excellent location right on the seafront. There was a good mix of people staying at the hotel. It was at the time of the last Football World Cup and there was a good atmosphere in the Sports Bar.
reviews.title: Great location, ok hotel

reviews.text: A buffet breakfast was available; the menu was lacking in Spanish authenticity.
reviews.title: Sitges is fantastic, this hotel is okay

reviews.text: The rooms weren't attractive;mine was painted orange and the bathroom was very small and basic.
reviews.title: Basic But Does A Great Job On A Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel was reasonably priced and not for those who like their creature comforts.
reviews.title: Second mVisit
Great Location and Value for money
reviews.text: I planned a trip to Barcelona and one of the Expedia picks turned out this hotel in Sitges so I looked into Sitges and it's a beach town about 30 min to an hour outside of Barcelona (depending on the unreliable train service). So I decided to spend two days at this hotel and three days in Barcelona city center.

I had seen the hotel on previous visits to Sitges but this was my first visit. The hotel is located on the seafront with most rooms having a side view of the sea. The rooms are simply but pleasantly furnished and have good bathrooms. Towels were of good quality and changed daily. I did not eat breakfast in the hotel often but it was typical of what is provided in a continental hotel. Staff were always helpful and moved me from the original room allocated (it had a window to a light shaft only) as soon as I asked.
reviews.title: Good value and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, a bit noisy but at a great location across the street from the beach. Rooms are decent and clean. Night life starts very late, so if you decide to go to sleep at 11pm, you will not hear anything. Great restaurants and shopping in the hotel vecinity. It's the right hotel for the money. Breakfast included is good. No complaints here.
reviews.title: Average, comfy hotel

reviews.text: Location is great - but - The noise is not. We had a side room with a balcony, sounds nice until nightfall. Noise from the neighbouring streets and bars is awful , all night long until may be 5am. At between 11pm - 1-00 am the local restaurants and residents decide to fill the bottle banks, what a racket , imagine they are emptying a box of maybe 30 empties at a time, sounds like the local vandals have just put a bus shelter glass through.( We never actually saw any vandalism ) Just when you think its safe you then have the street cleaning vehicles at 7-15am. I actually thought there was a Hellicopter hovering outside the Balcony. Then at about 7-30am you have a repeat of the bottle bank situation from the people that couldn't be bothered to disturb the peace at night. Not forgetting about the noisy mopeds all day long from school kids that never seem to attend school at all. Oh while on the subject of kids, they are out with their parents until about midnight, the kids range from about 2 years old upwards.
reviews.title: Noisy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a shame about the above as Sitges is a really nice place although we did not know that it is a predominantly GAY resort before we booked.
reviews.title: You can't miss...

likes.liked: — Position of the hotel and cleanliness

reviews.text: Another interesting thing is that we were surprised that very few people in this resort speak good English, fortunately we can get by in Spanish, but don't let this put you off.
reviews.title: Stayed on business

description: Located in the hearth of town, the Hotel Subur in Sitges offers an unbeatable location, comfort, service and atmosphere. Next to the famous "Calle del Pecador", in the historic and commercial center, waterfront parallel to the main beaches, participating in the character and charm of the people of Sitges, this is the privileged place where you can find the Hotel Subur.
